Individual site grading plans will be necessary where a permittee deviates from
the plans prepared by a registered professional engineer, which have previously
been approved by the City for an entire tract of land or subdivision.
         b.   Permit Application For New Buildings: All building permit
applications for new buildings or structures shall indicate the top of
foundation, the proposed finished grade, surface drainage, street and adjacent
property elevations.
      6.   Engineering Details: The building official may require adequate
details of structural, mechanical and electrical work including computations,
stress diagrams and other essential technical data to be filed. All engineering
plans and computations shall bear the signature of the State of Illinois
structural engineer or architect responsible for the design.
   E.   Emergency Repairs: Where equipment replacements and repairs must be
performed in an emergency situation, the permit application shall be submitted
within the next working business day.
   F.   Amendments To Applications: Amendments to a plan, application or other
records accompanying the same may be filed at any time before the permit is
issued; and such amendments shall be deemed part of the original application
and shall be filed therewith.
   G.   Time Limitation Of Application: An application for a permit for any
proposed work shall be deemed to have been abandoned one hundred eighty (180)
days after the date of filing, unless such application has been diligently
pursued or a permit shall have been issued; except that for reasonable cause,
the building official may grant one or more extensions of time for additional
periods not exceeding ninety (90) days each. The extension shall be requested
in writing and justifiable cause demonstrated. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018; amd.
Ord. O-22-019, 5-19-2022)
Sec. 12.504. Licensing, Registrations And Responsibility.
   A.   Contractors With Existing Violations: The City shall not be required to
issue a permit to, or perform inspections for work completed by, any contractor
or subcontractor responsible for existing code violations, fees or any
outstanding issues with the City until such work, fees, or issues have been
corrected.
   B.   Licensing And Registration Requirements: All contractors required to be
licensed by the State of Illinois must provide a copy of such license in
accordance with
chapter 4 of this Code. Contractors, required to register in accordance with
chapter 4 of this Code, must maintain a current registration for the duration
of the permit.
   C.   Professional Architecture Or Engineering Services: All new, alteration,
repair, expansion, addition or modification work involving the practice of
professional architecture or engineering as defined by the statutory
requirements of the professional registration laws of the State of Illinois,
shall be prepared by registered professional architects or structural engineers
as certified by the State. All plans, computations and specifications required
for a permit application for such work must be prepared by or under the direct
supervision of a registered architect or structural engineer and bear his/her
signature and seal in accordance with State Statutes and regulations governing
the professional registration and certification of architects or engineers.
   D.   Architect/Engineer Inspectional Responsibility: The professional
architect or engineer of record for a building permit application shall be
responsible for the following:
      1.   Review shop drawings, samples and other submittals of the contractor
as required by the construction contract documents as submitted for building
permit, and approval for conformance to the design concept.
      2.   Review and approval of the contractor's quality control procedures
for all code required controlled materials.
      3.   Provide special architectural or engineering professional
inspections of critical construction components requiring controlled materials
or construction in the accepted engineering practice standards. Copies of
special inspections shall be made available to the building official on
request.
      4.   The professional architect or engineer shall perform the necessary
professional services and be present on the construction site on a regular and
periodic basis to determine that, generally, the work is proceeding in
accordance with the documents approved for the building permit. (Ord. O-18-025,
7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.505. Issuance.
   A.   Action On Application: The building official shall examine or cause to
be examined all applications for permits and amendments thereto within a
reasonable time after filing. If the application or the plans do not conform to
the requirements of all pertinent laws, he/she shall reject such application in
writing stating the reasons therefor. If he/she is satisfied that the proposed
work conforms to the requirements of this chapter and all laws and ordinances
applicable thereto, he shall issue a permit therefor as soon as practicable.
   B.   Inadequate Access Or Utilities: No permit shall be issued if the
following circumstances are present:
      1.   Adequate and approved water supplies and sewerage facilities are not
available;
      2.   Surface drainage will damage adjoining properties;
      3.   Public improvements, as appropriate, are not installed; or
      4.   Access for emergency vehicles and equipment is not provided at all
times over a negotiable all weather roadway.
   C.   Signature To Permit: The building official shall attach his signature
to every permit, or he may authorize a subordinate to affix such signature
thereto.
   D.   Approved Plans: The building official shall stamp or endorse in writing
both sets of corrected plans approved, and one set of such approved plans shall
be retained by the Community Development Department and the other set shall be
kept at the building site, open to inspection of the building official or his
authorized representative at all reasonable times.
   E.   Fees:
      1.   General: A permit required by this chapter shall not be issued until
the payment of fees in full has been received by the City or other authorized
agency of the City, nor shall an amendment to a permit necessitating an
additional fee because of an increase in the scope of work be approved until
the additional fee shall have been paid. The permit fees applicable to all
development, building or construction within the City shall be those fees and
charges as specified in the master fee schedule or as otherwise specified.
      2.   Special Fees: The payment of fees for the work done in connection
with or concurrently with the work contemplated by a permit shall not relieve
the applicant or permittee from the payment of other fees that may be
prescribed by law or ordinance for water taps, sewer connections, erection of
signs and display structures, marquees or other appurtenant structures, or fees
for re-inspections, or other privileges or requirements, both within and
without the jurisdiction of the Community Development Department.
      3.   Fee Waiver: Requests for a fee waiver must be made in writing by the
property owner. Pass through costs (costs incurred by the City for work
conducted by a third-party on behalf of the City) are not eligible to be
waived. The City Manager must approve all fee waivers and the Development
Administrator shall maintain a record of all fees waived.
   F.   Approval Of Part: The building official may issue a permit for the
construction of foundations or any other part of a building or structure before
the entire plans and specifications for the whole building or structure have
been submitted, provided adequate information and detailed statements have been
filed complying with all the pertinent requirements of this chapter. The holder
of such permit for the foundations or other parts of a building or structure
shall proceed at his own risk with the building operation and without assurance
that a permit for the entire structure will be granted.
   G.   Permit Compliance: All work shall conform to the approved application
and plans for which the permit has been issued and any approved amendments
thereto.
   H.   Site Plan Compliance: All new construction shall be located strictly in
accordance with the approved site plan.
   I.   Construction Documents: During construction, a copy of the said plans
shall remain on file in the Community Development Department, and a duplicate
copy shall be returned to the permittee to be kept on the construction site. In
addition, for all construction other than single family residential, a copy of
the approved plans shall be forwarded to the applicable Fire Prevention Bureau
by the building official.
   J.   Expiration Of Building Permit And Extensions:
      1.   Permits are valid for one year from the date of issuance, unless
otherwise specified.
      2.   Operations covered by a permit shall be carried to completion
without delay and not drawn out over extended periods of time. Any permittee
holding an unexpired permit may apply for an extension of the time within which
he may commence work, or complete work within the time required by this section
for good and satisfactory reasons. The building official may extend the time
for action by the permittee for a period not exceeding one hundred eighty (180)
days upon written request by the permittee showing that circumstances beyond
the control of the permittee have prevented action from being taken. No permit
shall be extended more than twice, except upon review and approval by the City
Manager for an additional one hundred eighty (180) days. A fee as specified in
the master fee schedule shall be required for each extension period.
   K.   Suspension Of Permit: Any permit issued shall become invalid if the
authorized work is not commenced within one hundred eighty (180) days after the
time of permit issuance.
   L.   Surrender Of Building Permit; Refunds: At any time prior to the
expiration of one hundred eighty (180) days following the issuance of any
permit, provided that no work has commenced and no extension thereof shall be
in effect, the persons to whom such permits shall have been issued, or his
estate or assigns, may surrender such permit and shall thereupon be given a
refund as specified in the master fee schedule. No such refund shall be made
for a suspended or revoked permit.
   M.   Change During Construction: If during the progress of work under a
permit, it is desired to change the plans upon which the permit was issued, or
to change contractors, notice of such desired change must be filed with the
building official and a written permit obtained therefor before such changes
are made. If the scope of work increases by such changes, any additional fee
must be paid before approval of such change. Revised sets of plans showing the
changes shall be furnished, and one of these sets, approved by the building
official, shall replace those being kept with the permit card.
   N.   Notice Of Start: At least twenty four (24) hours' notice before the
start of work under a building permit for demolition and/or new construction
shall be given to the building official.
   O.   Loss Of Permit Card: In the event that the building permit card is
lost, defaced or stolen, it will be replaced upon application, in person, to
the building official, for a fee as specified in the master fee schedule.
   P.   Loss Of Approved Plans: In the event that the plans being kept with the
permit card are lost, defaced, stolen or illegible through handling and use, a
new set of plans will be endorsed by the building official upon personal
application at the Community Development Department for a fee as specified in
the master fee schedule.
   Q.   Validity Of Permit: The issuance or granting of a permit shall not be
construed to be a permit for, or an approval of, any violation of any of the
provisions of this Code or of any other ordinance of the City. Permits
presuming to give authority to violate or cancel the provisions of this Code or
other ordinances of the City shall not be valid. The issuance of a permit based
on construction documents and other data shall not prevent the building
official from requiring the correction of errors in the construction documents
and other data. The building official is also authorized to prevent occupancy
or use of a structure where in violation of this Code or of any other
ordinances of the City.
   R.   Revocation Of Permit: The building official is authorized to suspend or
revoke a permit issued under the provisions of this Code wherever the permit is
issued in error or on the basis of incorrect, inaccurate or incomplete
information, or in violation of any ordinance or regulation or any of the
provisions of this Code. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.506. Inspections.
   A.   Preliminary Inspection: Before issuing a permit, the building official
may examine or cause to be examined all buildings, structures and sites for
which an application has been filed for a permit.
   B.   Plant Inspection: When required by the provisions of this chapter or by
the approved rules, materials or assemblies shall be inspected at the point of
manufacture or fabrication in accordance with subsection F of this section.
   C.   Right Of Entry: In the discharge of his duties, the building official
or his/her designee shall have the authority to enter at any reasonable hour
any building, structure or premises in the City to enforce the provisions of
this chapter. Any failure to grant, or refusal of a building official or
designee right of entry for any required inspection shall result in an
additional inspection fee, as specified in the master fee schedule.
Interference with, or obstruction made to, any such building official or his or
her designee(s) while engaged in the performance of said duties shall result in
an additional inspection fee specified in the master fee schedule. Said fees
shall be imposed by staff and added to the amount owed to the City from the
permittee, owner, builder, contractor or agent for said construction. No
Certificate of Occupancy shall be issued in connection with said construction
until such time as said fees are paid in full.
   D.   Accredited Inspection Services: The building official may accept
reports of his/her own inspectors or may require and accept inspection and
reports of accredited consulting organizations. Fees for such outside
inspection, reports or services are to be paid by the permittee.
   E.   Time Of Inspections: The permittee shall notify the building official
at each of the times when the work has progressed to the point where it is
ready for the next inspection, in accordance with subsection G of this section.
The method and procedure for notification shall be determined by the building
official. The permittee, owner or contractor is required to schedule
inspections with the Community Development Department, a minimum of twenty four
(24) hours in advance to schedule any inspection. If a required spot survey is
not submitted prior to scheduling a rough framing inspection, an inspection
fee, as specified in the master fee schedule, may be imposed. Further, if any
required inspection has not been scheduled in accordance with subsection G, or
any Rough Framing begins prior to a spot survey being submitted to, and
approved by, the City, and/or the work or the survey does not comply with the
requirements of the City Code, an additional fee, as specified in the master
fee schedule, may be imposed by staff, and shall be paid prior the City
conducting any subsequent inspection(s).
   F.   Inspection Reports: All inspection reports shall be in writing and
shall be certified by the licensed authority or responsible officer of the
service or the individual when expert inspection services are accepted. An
identifying label or stamp permanently fixed to the product indicating that
factory inspection has been made may be accepted in lieu of the aforesaid
inspection report in writing if the intent or meaning of such identifying label
or stamp is properly substantiated.
      1.   Approval: As each stage or item of construction passes inspection,
the approval shall be recorded by the building official in his/her official
records thereby authorizing the continuation of work.
      2.   Disapproval: In case the work that has been performed or is about to
be completed does not conform to the City Code or other applicable ordinances,
the building official shall, as soon as practical, notify the contractor,
citing the violation(s) of the City Code or other ordinances which are the
reason for the failed inspection. That portion of the work which is disapproved
shall be corrected by the contractor or responsible party and re-inspected by
the building official or his/her designee. Any portion of work which is
disapproved by the building official after the first re-inspection shall be
subject to fees for subsequent inspections as provided for in the master fee
schedule. Any such work by the permittee, owner, builder, contractor or agent
commenced on the disapproved portion of said work after notice, other than to
cure non-conforming work, is a violation of the City Code and will be subject
to the fees set forth in the master fee schedule and added by staff, with an
increase in the fee for each violation hereof, as set forth in the master fee
schedule.
      3.   Post-Construction Variations: In case the work has been performed or
is about to be completed and does not conform with the City Code or other
applicable ordinances, the building official shall, as soon as practical,
notify the contractor, siting the violation(s) of the City Code or other
ordinances, the building official may, but is not required to, approve a
deviation which, in the opinion of the building official, constitute a de
minimis variation of deviation from the City Code requirements and will not
present or constitute an impact on the life-safety and/or health, safety and
welfare of the City or its residents. In such event, the fee set forth in the
master fee schedule shall be imposed by staff.
   G.   Required Inspections: All work for which a building permit has been
issued shall be periodically inspected to determine its conformity with the
City Code and the approved plans. Inspections required under the provisions of
this article shall be scheduled by the permittee, owner, builder, contractor,
or agent and conducted by the building official or his/her designee. Any
permittee, owner or contractor who fails to submit a spot survey before framing
or fails to schedule said inspection is in violation of this Code and shall be
subject to the fee specified in the master fee schedule, which fees shall be
imposed by staff.
      1.   Building/Structure: Timing and description of required inspections:
         a.   Site inspection: When required fencing and site requirements have
been installed but before the commencement of work.
         b.   Post holes: Before concrete is placed.
         c.   Footing/trench: When forms are set but before concrete is placed.
         d.   Foundation: When forms and reinforcing are set but before
concrete is placed.
         e.   Backfill: When foundation is damp-proofed, drain tile are
installed and covered with gravel and foundation insulation installed but
before backfill is placed.
         f.   Basement/crawlspace slab: When base, reinforcing and vapor
barrier are installed but before concrete is placed.
         g.   Stoop/step/ramp: When forms, base, reinforcing and flashing paper
are installed but before concrete is placed.
         h.   Garage slab: When forms, base, reinforcing and vapor barrier are
installed but before concrete is placed.
         i.   Rough framing: Once framing is completed but before any
insulation, gypsum board, or other interior finish material is installed. All
rough inspections of electrical, mechanical, and plumbing must be completed
before framing inspection.
         j.   Above ceiling: When all systems located in the ceiling have been
completed and approved, and the ceiling grid or framing is installed but before
any ceiling tiles, drywall or other interior finishes are installed.
         k.   Insulation: After insulation is completed but before interior
finishes are installed. All required rough inspections must be inspected
approved before this inspection.
         l.   Building paper: Once paper is installed and taped but before
siding, brick or other exterior covering materials are installed.
         m.   Underground mechanical: When all gas piping is installed but
before any concrete, backfill or other covering is placed.
         n.   HVAC rough: When rough is completed but before any insulation,
gypsum board or other interior finish materials are installed.
         o.   HVAC final: When all HVAC work is completed and system is
installed and operational.
         p.   Final inspection: When all work has been completed and prior to
any occupancy or use of the building or structure.
      2.   Electrical: Timing and description of required inspections:
         a.   Underground electrical: When all piping is installed but before
any concrete, backfill or other covering is placed.
         b.   Electrical rough: When rough is completed but before any
insulation, gypsum board, or other interior finish materials are installed.
         c.   Electrical above ceiling: When all electrical located in the
ceiling has been completed but before the ceiling grid or framing is installed.
         d.   Electrical service: When service is installed but before utility
company service connection is done.
         e.   Electrical bonding pool: When bonding wire has been installed but
before any concrete, backfill or other covering is placed.
         f.   Electrical final: When all electrical work is completed and the
system is installed and operational.
      3.   Plumbing: Timing and description of required inspections:
         a.   Underground plumbing: When all piping is installed but before any
concrete, backfill or other covering is placed. Includes the inspection of
underground radon piping.
         b.   Plumbing rough: When rough in work is completed but before any
insulation, gypsum board, or other interior finish materials are installed.
         c.   Plumbing above ceiling: When all plumbing located in the ceiling
has been completed but before the ceiling grid or framing is installed.
         d.   Plumbing final: When all plumbing work is completed and the
system is installed and operational.
      4.   Flatwork: Timing and description of required inspections:
         a.   Base: When forms, reinforcing and base are installed but before
asphalt, concrete or other covering is placed. (Applies to all work in the
right-of-way and only permeable surfacing on private property.)
         b.   Flatwork final: When the surface is completed and grading is
restored. Parking lots shall have all striping and signage installed.
      5.   Engineering: Timing and description of required inspections:
         a.   Culvert: Two (2) inspections required. One to locate and
establish grade, and one for final inspection.
         b.   Final engineering: When final grading and drainage has been
completed, seed or sod, or other vegetation approved by the City Engineer has
been established, and an "as built" survey, showing topographic elevation
prepared by registered Illinois engineer has been submitted; seal and signature
required. If an as built survey is submitted prior to the establishment of
after vegetation is established. For the purpose of this subsection
"established" shall be defined as vegetation in place that has sufficiently
developed whereby the soil has stabilized to minimize erosion.
      6.   City Utilities: Timing and description of required inspections:
         a.   Sewer and water tap: When the area has been excavated but before
any connection to the City water or sewer has been made.
         b.   Sewer/water service line: When tile or pipe and b-box is
installed but before any backfill material has been placed.
         c.   Sump discharge: When sump discharge line is in place to storm
sewer, ditch, or other approved termination point, and before any backfill is
placed.
         d.   Water meter: All water meters are to be installed by the plumbing
contractor and before final plumbing inspection. Water shall not be used until
the water meter is inspected and approved.
      7.   Fire Prevention: Timing and description of required inspections:
         a.   Underground flush: Flush of water main/fire protection systems to
the structures but before the installation of the backflow prevention system.
         b.   Hydrostatic test: When the sprinkler system is installed and
pressurized.
         c.   Fire alarm: When the system has been installed and ready to be
tested.
         d.   Type I hood and duct: When the hood has been completed.
         e.   Above ceiling: When all systems located in the ceiling have been
completed and approved, and the ceiling grid or framing is installed but before
any ceiling tiles, gypsum board or other interior finishes are installed.
         f.   NFPA inspection: A life safety inspection verifying approval of
all of the above prior to being granted occupancy.
      8.   Occupancy: Timing and description of required inspections:
      a.   Vacant structures: Structures left vacant due to abandonment of any
type, or vacant commercial and industrial occupancies that have been posted by
the City of Wood Dale Community Development Department must call for a
preoccupancy life safety inspection.
      9.   Zoning: Timing and description of required inspections:
         a.   Landscape final: Upon installation of all landscaping approved on
the landscape plan, where applicable.
   H.   Obstruction Of Inspection: No work shall be done which will cover or
obstruct from view construction work scheduled for inspection which is not yet
approved by the building official.
   I.   Re-Inspections: A City-issued building permit shall include an initial
inspection and one re-inspection. All subsequent re-inspections shall be
assessed a re-inspection fee by staff in accordance with the master fee
schedule, unless identified as a required critical final inspection, in which
case said inspection shall be subject to the additional fees specified in the
master fee schedule. No further inspections shall be scheduled until the re-
inspection fee has been paid. A re-inspection fee may also be assessed by staff
if the building official, or his/her designee, determines at a scheduled
inspection:
      1.   The job is not ready;
      2.   The job has not progressed to a point where an inspection can be
made properly;
      3.   Access is not possible to perform the inspection;
      4.   The job site has not been maintained free from excessive
construction debris; or
      5.   Upon re-inspection, not all previously identified code violations
have been corrected.
   J.    Final Inspection: Upon completion of the building or structure, and
before issuance of the certificate of occupancy required in section
12.508  of this article, a final inspection shall be made and all violations of
the approved plans, permit and City Code shall be noted and the permittee shall
be notified of the discrepancies. "Occupancy" and/or "use" shall not be allowed
until these violations are corrected, reinspected and approved. The required
final inspection is a critical inspection. Any permittee, owner, builder,
contractor or agent who fails to schedule or permit the final inspection is
subject to the additional fees as specified in the master fee schedule, which
fees shall be imposed by staff.
   K.   Negligence: Inspections conducted by the City are in addition to
inspections by the owner, architect, contractor, mortgagor and their agents and
employees. Approval by the building official shall not absolve others of their
negligence nor be made a defense of the negligence of others. (Ord. O-18-025,
7-19-2018; amd. Ord. O-23-026, 10-5-2023)
Sec. 12.507. Construction Compliance Documentation.
In addition to the required inspections, the following documentation may be
required by third parties to verify compliance with the approved plans.
   A.   Spot Survey: After the foundation has been constructed and prior to any
further construction of any given structure, the permittee shall submit a spot
survey drawn and sealed by a licensed Illinois land surveyor, which survey
shall show the dimensions from the exterior foundation walls to all adjacent
lot lines and display the height of the top of the foundation walls in
topographic terms. If the required spot survey(s) are not submitted in
accordance herewith, said failure shall subject the permittee, owner, builder,
contractor or agent who fails to submit said spot survey to the fines set forth
herein. Upon approval by the building official, the permittee may resume work.
   B.   Tests: The building official may require tests, or documentation, or
both, as proof of compliance to be made at the expense of the permittee by an
approved agency. Such tests may include but are not limited to soil, blower
door, welds/steel, etc.
   C.   Design Professional Certification: The architect or engineer who
prepares the plans as required by section
12.504 of this article may be required to submit a letter to the building
official certifying that the structure has been built or remodeled
substantially in conformance with the plans he prepared prior to any occupancy
and/or use of the premises. This provision shall not apply to one- and two-
family residences unless the building official determines that the work is of
such an unusual nature that the letter of certification should be required. In
this event the permit applicant and the architect shall be so notified.
   D.   As-Built Drawings: All as-built drawings must be prepared and signed
and sealed by the appropriate design professional licensed in Illinois and
shall be submitted electronically.
      1.   Single Family Homes: A final as-built plan shall be submitted
showing all final as-built dimensions of all buildings and/or structures
erected. The City shall review and approve the as- built drawings before the
public improvements are accepted by the City, as applicable, and prior to final
occupancy. The plan shall show all easements, setbacks, utilities, elevations,
grades, slopes, drainage routes, sidewalks, utility services, trees, and other
items as required.
      2.   Multi-Family, Commercial, And Subdivision Developments: A final as-
built plan shall be submitted showing all final as-built dimensions of all
buildings and/or structures erected. As-built engineering drawings shall be
submitted within fifteen (15) months of the date of permit issuance. The City
Engineer shall review and approve the as-built drawings before the public
improvements are accepted by the City and prior to final occupancy.
      3.   As-Built Engineering Drawings: The engineering as-builts shall be
based on the original approved engineering plans and shall show all items
depicted in the original approved plan(s) for all existing and proposed onsite
and offsite improvements. The as- built engineering drawings shall accurately
depict the as- constructed location, grade, slope, profile, elevation, contour,
rim, invert, stage/storage/volume, specified lid or grate, detail, size,
length, etc., for all improvements as shown on the originally approved plans.
Additionally, the as-built location of all streetlights and associated conduits
and control equipment, installed parkway trees, and all recorded easements
shall be clearly shown on the plan sheets for verification purposes. As- built
items deviating from their approved design may require additional documentation
prior to approval.
      4.   Approval: After approval of the as-built engineering drawings, final
mylar and digital as-built engineering drawings shall be submitted to the City.
Digital as-built submissions shall comply with the formatting set forth by the
City.
   E.   Private Well And Septic: All wells sealed in the City shall provide the
documentation required by and in accordance with subsection
7.310D of this Code. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018; amd. Ord. O-23-026, 10-5-2023)
Sec. 12.508. Certificate Of Occupancy.
   A.   Use And Occupancy: No building or part thereof, hereafter erected, or a
structure which shall hereafter be altered or repaired and for which a permit
has been required as provided in this chapter, shall be occupied in whole or in
part for human habitation or for use until the issuance of a certificate of
occupancy by the building official. Issuance of a certificate of occupancy
shall not be construed as an approval of a violation of the provisions of this
Code or of other ordinances of the City. Certificates presuming to give
authority to violate or cancel provisions of this Code or other ordinances of
the City shall not be valid.
   B.   Changes In Use And Occupancy: After a change of use has been made in a
building or structure, the reestablishment of a prior use that would not have
been legal in a new building of the same type of construction is prohibited
unless the building complies with all applicable provisions of this chapter. A
change from one prohibited use, for which a permit has been granted, to another
prohibited use shall be deemed a violation of this chapter. Changes in use
shall also be in accordance with
chapter 17 of this Code.
   C.   Contents Of Certificate: When a building or structure is entitled
thereto, the building official shall issue a certificate of occupancy which
shall contain the following:
      1.   The building permit number;
      2.   The address of the structure;
      3.   The name and address of the owner;
      4.   A description of that portion of the structure for which the
certificate is issued;
      5.   A statement that the described portion of the structure has been
inspected for compliance with the requirements of this Code;
      6.   The name of the building official;
      7.   The edition of the code under which the permit was issued;
      8.   The use and occupancy;
      9.   The type of construction;
      10.   The design occupant load;
      11.   If an automatic sprinkler system is provided, whether the sprinkler
system is required; and
      12.   Any special stipulations and conditions of the building permit.
   D.   Temporary Occupancy: The building official may approve temporary
occupancy or use of a building or structure for the reason that because of
weather, it would be impossible to complete the grading or other site work, or
in extraordinary circumstances as determined by the building official.
Temporary occupancy shall not be approved by the building official due to
incomplete grading of site work if this incomplete work will create a nuisance
to adjacent properties. Such temporary occupancy due to weather will be granted
only between November 15 and April 15 of each year and shall not extend the
original expiration date of the permit. The conditions and restrictions of the
occupancy shall be listed on the certificate of occupancy and a time limit
shall be established and included. A temporary certificate of occupancy shall
not be issued until the fee as specified in the master fee schedule has been
paid.
   E.   Partial Occupancy: The building official may approve partial occupancy
or use of part of a building or structure provided the area to be occupied is
completely separated from the remaining construction, all life safety systems
are approved and operational, and the area to be occupied will pose no risk or
danger to the occupants during the completion of the remaining work. A partial
certificate of occupancy shall not be issued until the fee as specified in the
master fee schedule has been paid.
   F.   Site Improvements: In addition to the required inspection, the
following improvements and documentation shall be provided by the permittee
prior to the issuance of a certificate of occupancy:
      1.   The buffalo (water shut-off) box shall be adjusted to grade, and be
accessible and operable.
      2.   All public and private sidewalks on and immediately adjacent to the
lot shall be completed.
      3.   Any replacement or repair to damaged curbs and gutters, streets,
sidewalks, driveways and street lighting shall be completed.
      4.   All final grading within the lot and parkway areas shall be
completed, and a final topographical survey shall be submitted indicating that
the grading has been completed in compliance with the approved subdivision or
site grading plan and that all overland stormwater flow conforms with said
grading plan.
      5.   All required yards and parkway areas shall be sodded or seeded and a
homogeneous grass surface shall be satisfactorily established.
      6.   Trees of an approved species shall be planted in all parkway areas.
The species, number and spacing of such trees shall be in conformance with
applicable City regulations.
      7.   All other required landscaping shall be installed.
      8.   In addition to the construction compliance documentation specified
in section
12.507 of this article, other items including, but not limited to, deed of
conveyance/bill of sale for public improvements to be conveyed to the City,
original lien waivers, easements, and maintenance securities may be required
prior to final occupancy and project close-out.
   G.   Revocation: The building official shall, in writing, suspend or revoke
a certificate of occupancy issued under the provisions of this Code wherever
the certificate is issued in error, or on the basis of incorrect information
supplied, or where it is determined that the building or structure or portion
thereof is in violation of any ordinance or regulation or any provision of this
Code. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
ARTICLE VI
SITE MANAGEMENT
SECTION:
12.601. Posting Of Permit
12.602. Construction Documents
12.603. Notification
12.604. Construction Site
12.605. Public Safety Considerations
Sec. 12.601. Posting Of Permit.
The permit card shall be posted by the permittee on the site of the
construction work in a readily accessible location so that it is visible from
the street and protected from rain and snow. The permit card shall remain
posted from the commencement of construction until the final approval has been
granted by the building official or his authorized agent. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-
2018)
Sec. 12.602. Construction Documents.
In all construction work for which a permit is required, the approved and
stamped construction documents shall be kept on file at the construction site
while the work is in progress. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.603. Notification.
Notification to the adjacent properties within one hundred feet (100') of the
construction site is required by the applicant for any permit issued for
demolition, new construction or an addition that will add four hundred (400)
square feet or more of gross floor area to an existing structure. Such
notification shall be made no less than seven (7) days prior to the
commencement of any work and shall consist of providing adjacent property
owners or tenants with a copy of the site plan, a general explanation of the
work to be done, and the name, address and telephone number of the individual
supervising the work. Each applicant shall submit written certification, on a
form provided by the City, of personal notification to all adjacent property
owners located within one hundred feet (100') of the construction site as a
condition of permit issuance. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.604. Construction Site.
   A.   Construction Operations: All construction operations shall be conducted
in a manner that least inconveniences the public and abutting property owners.
   B.   Work Location And Access: All work conducted in connection with a
permit shall be limited to the construction site. No permit issued pursuant to
this section shall authorize any entry onto the property adjoining the
construction site or any work for which entry onto property adjoining the
construction site is or may be necessary, unless a proper right of entry has
been secured from the owner of the adjoining property.
   C.   Signage: A temporary construction sign shall be installed on all
construction sites where a principal building is being demolished, a new
building is being constructed or an addition is being constructed that exceeds
four hundred (400) square feet in area. The temporary sign shall not exceed six
(6) square feet in area, or five feet (5') in height. The sign shall display
the construction company name and telephone number, and the site address with
at least four inch (4") letters and numbers. The sign may also display the
building permit in accordance with section 12.601 of this article.
   D.   Construction Hours: All construction related work is limited to Monday
through Saturday from seven o'clock (7:00) A.M. until seven o'clock (7:00) P.M.
No work is permitted on Sundays and holidays. Permittee will be responsible for
ensuring that all subcontractors comply with this requirement.
   E.   Fencing: A six foot (6') chainlink construction fence is required on
construction sites that are determined unsafe due to the nature of the site,
including but not limited to excavations two feet (2') or greater in depth and
unsecured buildings, or extended delays. The fence must be located within the
property lines, must fully enclose building or excavation, be locked or
otherwise secured when no work is occurring and maintained in good condition.
When required, it shall be in place prior to any work commencing and must
remain in place until the structure is secured and the property is properly
graded.
   F.   Silt Fence: A silt fence may be required in accordance with chapter 17,
article VIII of this Code or as required to control erosion, protect the sewers
or to prevent a nuisance or unsafe condition.
   G.   Portable Toilet: A portable toilet shall be required for demolition of
a principal structure, new construction, additions or remodels if there is no
access to an existing facility onsite, or as required by the building official.
It shall be placed on the construction site prior to any work commencing and
should be placed within the confines of the construction fence, as applicable,
with consideration given to adjacent neighbors. The portable toilet shall be
removed once a functioning toilet is available on the construction site.
   H.   Site Cleanliness: The construction site shall be cleaned at the end of
each workday, including the removal of mud and debris from the street, removal
of snow and ice from sidewalks, and proper enclosure of construction debris and
litter in a refuse container.
   I.   Construction Traffic Management: All construction traffic shall be
confined to one side of the street, unless otherwise approved by the building
official.
   J.   Dust Control: Any dust created due to job site construction must be
contained. Tenting of the area and use of wet saws and/or a hose is
recommended.
   K.   Temporary Trailers: All temporary trailers; offices, models, storage
and cargo containers, where allowed, shall be anchored to the ground. If the
trailers have water and drainage, they must be hooked up to City water and
sewer, no holding tanks. Any temporary electrical service shall be in
accordance with the NEC.
   L.   Noise: The noise regulations in section
14.508 of this Code shall apply.
   M.   Excavations:
      1.   Until provision for permanent support has been made, excavations
shall be properly guarded and protected to prevent the same from becoming
dangerous to life and limb, and where necessary, shall be sheet piled or braced
to prevent any adjoining earth and structures from caving in by reason of its
own weight.
      2.   All open holes and basements on a construction site shall be pumped
out until all excess water is removed.
      3.   No concrete shall be poured nor shall reinforcing steel be placed or
sewers laid in standing water or mud.
      4.   Existing subsurface drains found during excavation shall be joined
to effect uninterruption of flow in a manner acceptable to the building
official. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.605. Public Safety Considerations.
   A.   Occupation Or Obstruction Of Streets, Sidewalks And Parkways:
      1.   Streets, parkways or sidewalks shall not be occupied with building
materials without prior written approval by the building official and in no
instances prior to the issuance of a building permit. In no event shall public
property other than that immediately in front of the lot or land upon which the
work is being done be occupied, nor shall more than one-third (1/3) of the
streets, from curb line to curb line, be occupied. No material shall be so
placed as to render inaccessible any fire hydrant, valve chamber, manhole or
catch basin, or obstruct the gutter or waterway of any street.
      2.   Before any sidewalk is obstructed by scaffolding or other material,
or is removed, a safe hard surfaced temporary bypass walk shall be constructed
and maintained. Pedestrians shall be protected from vehicle traffic by a
barricade or fence. During overhead construction pedestrians shall further be
protected from falling debris by solid overhead planking.
      3.   The person or persons using public property for storage or
construction shall provide substantial and suitable barricades and shall
provide, place and maintain proper and sufficient red lights or flares to guard
and protect all traffic and passersby.
      4.   Whoever maliciously or wantonly and without legal cause, removes,
extinguishes, diminishes or disturbs any light or barricade so placed shall be
liable to a penalty in accordance with article VII of this chapter.
      5.   Mortar beds or boxes shall be so placed and guarded as to protect
the clothing of persons passing and shall not be located upon any street or
public way unless enclosed with a tight fence. Mortar beds or boxes shall not
be placed upon any public sidewalk, and no mortar shall be mixed upon any
pavement surface or sidewalk surface.
      6.   As soon as construction work is completed, all remaining material
shall be promptly removed from public and private property and the streets and
sidewalks shall be cleared and put in the same condition as before the
construction work was started.
      7.   Rubbish or excavated material which is deposited on the sidewalks or
streets shall be removed as rapidly as produced. When materials or rubbish
causing dust are handled, they must be well wetted down, and burning of rubbish
is not allowed.
      8.   Rubbish or surplus materials shall not be thrown, dropped or swept
from any floor above the ground or from any roof but shall either be carried or
lowered in such a manner as not to cause dust.
      9.   Where during construction, an excavation or other hazard exists, the
contractor shall provide and maintain a barricade or fence for the protection
of passersby.
      10.   On a regular basis throughout the period of construction, all
surplus building materials and their packing shall be removed from the job
site. In no instance shall such materials and/or packing be burned on or near
the job site.
   B.   Construction Management Bond: When specified in the master fee
schedule, a construction management bond shall be required in addition to all
other application and permit fees, escrows, bonds and performance securities.
The construction management bond shall stand as security for the full and
complete performance by the applicant of the work covered by the permit,
ensuring the initiation of construction in a timely manner, proper management
of the site, the building or structure is not occupied or used prior to
issuance of a certificate of occupancy and to cover the cost of any damages to
public property, subject to the following provisions:
      1.   The City shall have the right at all times, at its option, to draw
on the site management bond for the costs, including, without limitation, legal
fees and administrative expenses incurred or to be incurred by the City in
exercising any of its rights under this chapter in the event:
         a.   The applicant or permittee undertakes work in violation of any
provision of this chapter or of any permit issued or plan approved pursuant to
this chapter;
         b.   Damage is done to public property that has not been repaired by
the permittee and the City must perform or have performed the repair necessary;
or
         c.   The applicant or permittee fails or refuses to complete any work
authorized by any permit issued under this chapter in accordance with all plans
approved in connection with said permit. The City's determination of such costs
shall be based either on costs actually incurred by the City or on the City's
reasonable estimates of costs to be incurred.
      2.   If the City draws on the construction management bond, then the
applicant shall replenish the bond to the full amount required by this section
immediately after demand therefor is made to the applicant in writing by the
City. Any failure of the applicant or permittee to replenish the bond shall
result in cancellation of the related permit, which permit shall not be
reissued thereafter except after the filing of a new application therefor,
repayment of the permit fee, and establishment of a new construction management
bond.
      3.   Upon certification by the building official of the satisfactory
completion of the work, that no damage was done to public property and the
building or structure was not occupied or used prior to the issuance of a
certificate of occupancy, the balance of the construction management bond shall
be refunded to the permittee.
      4.   The City may accept a letter of credit or other surety in lieu of a
cash bond; provided, that said surety is in a form approved by the City
Attorney.
      5.   In the event the cost of repairs for damage done to public property
exceeds the amount of bond, such additional cost shall be charged to the
permittee.
      6.   In the event the building is occupied in whole or part without a
certificate of occupancy, the construction management bond shall be forfeited
to the City. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
ARTICLE VII
VIOLATIONS
SECTION:
12.701. Unlawful Acts
12.702. Persons Liable
12.703. Procedures Upon Discovery Of Violations
12.704. Prosecution Of Violation
12.705. Violation Penalties
12.706. Abatement Of Violation
Sec. 12.701. Unlawful Acts.
It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to violate, neglect,
refuse to comply with, or assist or participate in any way in the violation of
any of the provisions or requirements of this chapter. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-
2018)
Sec. 12.702. Persons Liable.
The owner, tenant, or occupant of any building or land or part thereof, any
architect, builder, contractor, agent, or other person who participates in,
assists, directs, creates, or maintains any situation that is contrary to the
requirements of this chapter may be held responsible for the violation and
suffer the penalties and be subject to the remedies herein provided. (Ord. O-
18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.703. Procedures Upon Discovery Of Violations.
   A.   If the building official finds that any provision of this chapter is
being violated, he/she shall send a written notice to the person responsible
for such violation, indicating the nature of the violation and ordering the
action necessary to correct it. Additional written notices may be sent at the
building official's discretion.
   B.   The final written notice (and the initial written notice may be the
final notice) shall state what action the building official intends to take if
the violation is not corrected and shall advise that the building official's
decision or order may be appealed to the Building Code Board of Appeals in
accordance with article VIII of this chapter.
   C.   Notwithstanding the foregoing, in cases when delay would seriously
threaten the effective enforcement of this chapter or pose a danger to the
public health, safety, or welfare, the building official may seek enforcement
without prior written notice by invoking any of the penalties or remedies
authorized in this article. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.704. Prosecution Of Violation.
If the notice of violation is not complied with promptly, the building official
shall institute the appropriate proceeding at law or in equity to restrain,
correct or abate such violation or to require the removal or termination of the
unlawful use of the building or structure in violation of the provisions of
this chapter or of the order or direction made pursuant thereto. (Ord. O-18-
025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.705. Violation Penalties.
Violations shall be subject to enforcement and penalties as defined in
chapter 1, article IV  of this Code, and in amounts as specified in the master
fee schedule. Any violation of, or resistance to or interference with the
enforcement of this Chapter by any architect, builder, contractor, agent, or
other person who participates in, assists, directs, creates, or maintains any
situation to which no other penalty provision is applicable, is subject to a
fee as specified in the master fee schedule, which fees shall be imposed by
staff. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018; amd. Ord. O-23-026, 10-5-2023)
Sec. 12.706. Abatement Of Violation.
The imposition of the penalties herein prescribed shall not preclude the
building official from instituting appropriate actions to prevent unlawful
construction or to restrain, correct or abate a violation, or to prevent
illegal occupancy of a building, structure or premises or to stop an illegal
act, conduct, business or use of a building or structure in or about any
premises. Such actions can include but are not limited to the following:
   A.   Stop Work Order:
      1.   Authority: Whenever the building official finds any work regulated
by this chapter being performed in a manner either contrary to the provisions
of this article, or, in a dangerous or unsafe manner, such work shall be
immediately stopped.
      2.   Issuance: The stop work order shall be in writing and given to the
owner of the property involved, or to the owner's agent, or to the person doing
the work. Upon issuance of a stop work order, the cited work shall immediately
cease. The stop work order shall cite the reason for the order, and the
conditions under which the cited work will be permitted to resume.
      3.   Unlawful Continuance: Any person who shall continue any work after
being served with a stop work order, except such work that person is directed
to perform to remove a violation or unsafe condition, shall be subject to the
penalties provided for in this article.
   B.   Unsafe Structures:
      1.   Right Of Condemnation: All buildings or structures that are or
hereafter shall become unsafe, unsanitary or deficient in adequate exitway
facilities, or which constitute a fire hazard or are otherwise dangerous to
human life or the public welfare, or which by reason of illegal or improper
use, occupancy or maintenance, shall be deemed unsafe buildings or structures.
All unsafe structures shall be taken down and removed or made safe and secure
as the building official may deem necessary and as provided in this section. A
vacant building unguarded or open at door or window shall be deemed a fire
hazard and unsafe within the meaning of this chapter. Unsafe structures are to
be posted in a conspicuous location near the main entry. It shall be unlawful
to occupy a structure that has been deemed unsafe.
      2.   Examination And Record Of Damaged Structure: The building official
shall examine every building or structure reported as dangerous, unsafe
structurally or constituting a fire hazard; and he shall cause the report to be
filed in a docket of unsafe structures and premises, stating the use of the
structure, the nature and estimated amount of damages, if any, caused by
collapse, failure or negligence.
      3.   Notice Of Unsafe Structure: If an unsafe condition is found in a
building or structure, the building official shall serve on the owner, agent or
person in control of the building or structure a written notice describing the
building or structure deemed unsafe and specifying the required repairs or
improvements to be made to render the building or structure safe and secure, or
requiring the unsafe building or structure or portion thereof to be demolished
within a stipulated time. Such notice shall require the person thus notified to
immediately declare to the building official his acceptance or rejection of the
terms of the order.
      4.   Restoration Of Unsafe Structure: A building or structure condemned
by the building official may be restored to safe condition provided change of
use or occupancy is not contemplated or compelled by reason of such
reconstruction or restoration; except, that if the damage or cost of
reconstruction or restoration is in excess of fifty percent (50%) of its
physical value, exclusive of foundations, such structure shall be made to
comply in all respects with the requirements for materials and methods of
construction for new structures. Further, restoration criteria shall be
governed by provisions of
chapter 17 of this Code.
      5.   Posting Unsafe Notice: If the person addressed with an unsafe notice
cannot be found within the City after diligent search, then such notice shall
be sent by registered or certified mail to the last known address of such
person and a copy of the unsafe notice shall be posted in a conspicuous place
on the premises, and such procedure shall be deemed the equivalent of personal
notice.
      6.   Disregard Of Unsafe Notice: Upon refusal or neglect of the person
served with an unsafe notice to comply with the requirements of the order to
abate the unsafe condition, the City Attorney shall be advised of all the facts
and he shall institute the appropriate action to compel compliance.
   C.   Dangerous Foundation And Excavations:
      1.   Whenever the building official shall find that any foundation or
excavation is in a dangerous condition, he shall thereupon cause written notice
to be served upon the owner, contractor, occupant or person in custody thereof,
if any, by registered mail or by personal service. Such notice shall state that
the foundation has been declared to be in dangerous condition, and that such
dangerous condition must be removed or remedied by pumping said water out of
the foundation and that the condition must be remedied at once.
      2.   If no owner can be located within a timely manner, the building
official can require security measures be implicated as needed including safety
fencing, the removal of water, or other actions to remedy the property safe at
the property owner's expense.
   D.   Emergency Measures:
      1.   Vacating Structures:
         a.   When, in the opinion of the building official there is actual and
immediate danger of failure or collapse of a building or structure or any part
thereof which would endanger life, or when any structure or part of a structure
has fallen and life is endangered by the occupation of the building or
structure, the building official is hereby authorized and empowered to order
and require the occupants to vacate the same forthwith. He shall cause to be
posted at each entrance to such building a notice reading as follows:
   This structure is unsafe and its use or occupancy has been prohibited by the
Building Official, and it shall be unlawful for any person to enter such
building or structure except for the purpose of making the required repairs or
of demolishing the same.
         b.   When a building or structure is disconnected from the City water
system, or the City sanitary sewer system, or an existing private water well
system ceases operation, the building official shall consider this building or
structure as an "unsafe structure" by reason of improper sanitation, and said
building or structure shall be posted as "Unsafe, Do Not Occupy" until such
repairs or reconnections are completed, and approved.
      2.   Temporary Safeguards: When, in the opinion of the building official,
there is actual and immediate danger of collapse or failure of a building or
structure or any part thereof which would endanger life, he shall cause the
necessary work to be done or render such building or structure or part thereof
temporarily safe, whether or not the legal procedure herein described has been
instituted.
      3.   Closing Streets: When necessary for the public safety, the building
official may temporarily close sidewalks, streets, buildings and structures and
places adjacent to such unsafe structure, and prohibit the same from being
used.
      4.   Emergency Repairs: For the purpose of this section, the building
official shall employ the necessary labor and materials to perform the required
work as expeditiously as possible.
      5.   Costs Of Emergency Repairs: Costs incurred in the performance of
emergency work shall be paid from the City on certificate of the building
official; and the legal authority of the City shall institute appropriate
action against the owner of the premises where the unsafe building or structure
was located for the recovery of such costs as specified in the master fee
schedule.
   E.   Willful Failure To Abate:
      1.   Any architect, builder, contractor, agent, or other person who
knowingly, intentionally, or without regard to the provisions of this Chapter
causes any work to be performed or completed in violation of this Chapter shall
be subject to the fee provided for in the master fee schedule, which fees shall
be imposed by staff. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018; amd. Ord. O-23-026, 10-5-2023)
ARTICLE VIII
APPEALS
SECTION:
12.801. General Provisions
12.802. Application
12.803. Public Hearing
12.804. Decision Of The Board Of Appeal
12.805. Appeals From Decisions Of The Board Of Appeal
Sec. 12.801. General Provisions.
   A.   Any person shall have the right to appeal a decision of the building
official to the Building Code Board of Appeals in accordance with the
provisions as prescribed in this article and in accordance with
chapter 3 of this Code.
   B.   The Board of Appeals shall have no authority to waive or vary
requirements of the Building Code. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.802. Application.
   A.   The application for appeal shall be filed on a form obtained from the
building official with the fee as specified in the master fee schedule within
twenty (20) days from the date of the decision appealed.
   B.   An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true
intent of the code or the legally adopted rules have been incorrectly
interpreted, the provisions of the code do not fully apply, or an equally good
or better form of construction is proposed. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.803. Public Hearing.
   A.   Upon receipt of a completed application and payment of fees as
specified in the master fee schedule, a hearing before the Board of Appeals
will be scheduled at the next established meeting date or as soon as practical.
   B.   Compliance with strict rules of evidence is not required, but only
relevant information will be admissible.
   C.   When all members are not present to hear an appeal, either the
appellant or the appellant's representative shall have the right to request a
postponement of the hearing. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.804. Decision Of The Board Of Appeal.
   A.   The Board of Appeal shall, in every case, reach a decision without
unreasonable or unnecessary delay. Every decision of the Board of Appeal shall
be in writing and shall indicate the vote upon the decision. Every decision
shall be promptly filed in the office of the building official and shall be
open to public inspection. A certified copy shall be sent by mail or otherwise
to the appellant and a copy shall be kept publicly posted in the office of the
building official for two (2) weeks after filing.
   B.   The Board of Appeals shall modify or reverse the decision of the
building official by a concurring vote of two-thirds (2/3) of its members. If a
decision of the Building Code Board of Appeal reverses or modifies an
interpretation, the building official shall take action immediately in
accordance with such decision. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.805. Appeals From Decisions Of The Board Of Appeal.
A person aggrieved by a decision of said Board, whether previously a party to
the proceeding or not, or an officer or board, may, within fifteen (15) days
after the filing decision in the office of the building official, apply to the
appropriate court to correct errors of law in such decisions. (Ord. O-18-025,
7-19-2018)
ARTICLE IX
MOVED BUILDINGS
SECTION:
12.901. General
12.902. Requirements
Sec. 12.901. General.
Buildings and structures moved into or from place to place within the City
shall comply with the provisions of this article and all other applicable
sections of this chapter for new buildings and structures. The fee to relocate
a building shall be as specified in the master fee schedule plus fees for new
construction and remodeling, as required. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.902. Requirements.
   A.   No unnecessary damage or injury shall be done to public or private
property on account of such moving which may be avoided by reasonable diligence
and intelligent care.
Notice shall be given by the applicant to each local agent of any telephone,
cable service providers, gas, electric, light and power or railroad company
involved, of the day and hour when, and the place where, such moving
necessitates the interruption of any services provided by any of said
companies, and the moving, cutting or altering of the property shall not be
attempted unless such notice has been duly served.
   B.   No trees shall be cut or trimmed without permission given by the
building official.
   C.   No building in the process of being moved shall be allowed to stand in
any street for more than four (4) hours at any one time, except on legal
holidays and at night and in cases of accident and unavoidable delay due to an
accident.
   D.   Red lights and flares shall be so displayed at night as to warn
passersby of all danger about any building in the process of being moved.
   E.   No chains, tools or other moving implements shall be allowed to litter
the streets when moving is not in process.
   F.   When necessary, the street, alley or sidewalk on or along which any
building is to be moved shall be protected by planking. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-
2018)
ARTICLE X
DRIVEWAYS AND CULVERTS
SECTION:
12.1001. Driveways
12.1002. Culverts
Sec. 12.1001. Driveways.
   A.   Driveways Required: It shall be mandatory for any person constructing
any new building, or remodeling any building where the estimated valuation of
the improvement exceeds twenty five percent (25%) of the estimated value of the
building, to construct a paved driveway in conjunction with the new or
remodeled building unless there existed such a paved driveway to serve the
building being remodeled. The driveway shall lead from the public street and
terminate at the required off street parking spaces provided.
   B.   Plans:
      1.   Plans and specifications shall be submitted to the building official
simultaneously with the plans required with the application for the building
permit.
      2.   All construction shall be done in accordance with the following:
         a.   No person shall cut a curb, build, construct, maintain or use a
driveway leading from a public street into private property until the approval
of the Director of Public Works shall first have been duly requested and
obtained.
         b.   The driveway shall be a minimum of eight feet (8') in width.
         c.   All driveways shall extend to the curb or curb line. It shall be
mandatory to have said driveway installed prior to the occupancy of the
premises.
         d.   No driveway shall be so constructed or graded as to leave a step,
sharp depression or other obstruction on the sidewalk. The grade shall be as
nearly as possible to the same as that of the adjoining sidewalk. It shall be
unlawful to have the surface finish of any driveway where the same crosses the
sidewalk constructed of such material as to render it slippery or hazardous to
pedestrians, or to have the grade of such portion vary from the grade of the
sidewalk, or to be other than level. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1002. Culverts.
   A.   All buildings hereafter constructed shall be provided with adequately
sized and designed culverts in any drainage ditch over which a driveway is to
be constructed.
   B.   Upon application for a building and/or driveway permit the applicant
shall detail the size and design of all required culverts on the permit
application plans.
   C.   The design, size, location and elevation of all culverts shall be
reviewed and approved by the Director of Public Works and/or the City Engineer.
   D.   Two (2) inspections of all culvert installations are required. One
inspection shall be conducted prior to covering the culvert with any fill
material and one inspection shall be conducted after the installation is
completed.
   E.   The Building Department shall be notified of the request for inspection
in the same manner as for all other required inspections. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-
2018)
ARTICLE XI
MOBILE HOMES AND MOBILE HOME PARKS
SECTION:
12.1101. Mobile Homes In Licensed Parks Only
12.1102. Park Licenses
12.1103. Sanitary Conditions
12.1104. Lighting Requirements
12.1105. Removal Of Wheels Prohibited
12.1106. Unoccupied Mobile Homes Or Housecars
12.1107. Compliance With Provisions
Sec. 12.1101. Mobile Homes In Licensed Parks Only.
It shall be unlawful to maintain any housecar or mobile home used for human
habitation upon any plat of ground in other than a licensed housecar or mobile
home park within the City. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1102. Park Licenses.
   A.   License Required: It shall be unlawful to establish or operate within
the limits of the City a housecar or mobile home park without a license.
   B.   Application For License; Fee: Any person desiring any such housecar or
mobile home park license may apply for and obtain a license as provided in
section
4.302 of this Code.
The fee for a housecar or mobile home park license shall be as provided in
subsection
4.302F of the master fee schedule.
   C.   Plans: The application for a housecar or mobile home park license shall
be accompanied by plans of the park showing the proposed or existing location
of all buildings, toilet, bath and washbasin facilities, slop sinks, water
faucets, sewer connections, driveways and other improvements. (Ord. O-18-025,
7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1103. Sanitary Conditions.
   A.   Water Supply: An adequate supply of pure water for drinking and
domestic purposes shall be supplied to meet the requirements of all housecar
and mobile home parks. Water shall be obtained from faucets only, conveniently
located in the park. No common drinking cups shall be permitted, and each cap
shall have a water meter. Any privately owned and operated public water system
shall comply with DuPage County Health Department, and the State of Illinois
rules, regulations, and licensure requirements.
   B.   Sewer Connections Required: It shall be unlawful to permit any
wastepaper or material from toilets, showers, bathtubs, washbasins or other
plumbing fixtures in a housecar or mobile home park or from the vehicles
themselves to be deposited upon the surface of the ground; all fixtures, when
in use, must be connected to the City sewer system by means of rigid pipe.
   C.   Removal Of Garbage Required: It shall be the duty of the owner of a
housecar or mobile home park, his agent or caretaker to provide for the
collection and removal of garbage or other waste material and to otherwise
maintain the park in a clean and sanitary condition.
   D.   Sanitary Facilities: Each housecar or mobile home park shall provide
toilets, baths or showers, slop sinks and garbage containers which shall be in
accordance with law. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1104. Lighting Requirements.
All housecar or mobile home parks shall be kept properly and adequately lighted
at all times so that the grounds shall be safe for occupants and visitors.
(Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1105. Removal Of Wheels Prohibited.
It shall be unlawful to remove the wheels or other transporting device from any
housecar or mobile home or otherwise to affix the car or home permanently to
the ground so as to prevent its ready removal. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1106. Unoccupied Mobile Homes Or Housecars.
This article shall not prohibit the storage of any housecar or mobile home on
the home premises of its owner for any length of time when it is not used for
living or sleeping purposes. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1107. Compliance With Provisions.
No person shall maintain any housecar or mobile home used for human habitation
upon any plat of ground in other than a licensed housecar or mobile home park,
except in compliance with the provisions of this article. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-
2018)
ARTICLE XII
RESIDENTIAL CONDOMINIUM CONVERSIONS
SECTION:
12.1201. Short Title
12.1202. General Purpose And Intent
12.1203. Definitions
12.1204. Construction
12.1205. Applicability
12.1206. Certification And Code Inspections
12.1207. Maintenance Responsibility
12.1208. Penalty
12.1209. Appeals
12.1210. Other Code Provisions And Statutes
Sec. 12.1201. Short Title.
This article shall be known and may be cited as the WOOD DALE RESIDENTIAL
CONDOMINIUM CONVERSION ORDINANCE. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1202. General Purpose And Intent.
The Illinois Legislature has determined that each municipality may ensure that
in the event of conversion from rental housing to condominium units that the
property complies with the municipality's Life Safety, Building and Unified
Development Codes to protect the City, residents and rights of the condominium
purchaser.
The purpose and intent of this article is to introduce regulatory elements into
the condominium conversion process to protect the rights of the condominium
purchasers and to ensure that the property meets City codes by facilitating
code inspections by the City which will reduce the possibility of a condominium
containing material defects or be in violation of the City codes such that
conversion would have an adverse effect on the health, safety and welfare of
its occupants or neighboring property, or would place unexpected burdens on
condominium unit buyers. (Ord. O-18-025, 7-19-2018)
Sec. 12.1203. Definitions.
For the purposes of this article, the following words and phrases shall have
the meanings ascribed to them in this section. To the extent not set forth in
this section, the definitions set forth in the Illinois Condominium Property
Act 1  shall apply.
AGENT: Any person, firm, corporation, association, joint venture or any other
entity or any combination thereof who represents or acts for or on behalf of an
owner and/or developer on the sale or offer for sale of any condominium unit,
excepting an escrow officer acting for a title company.
ASSOCIATION OR UNIT OWNERS' ASSOCIATION: The association of all the condominium
unit owners, acting pursuant to bylaws through its duly elected board of
managers/directors.
BOARD OF MANAGERS: The body designated to act on behalf of the unit owners'
association.
BUILDING: All structures, attached or unattached, containing one or more
dwelling units.
CERTIFICATE OF CODE COMPLIANCE: A written instrument issued by the City's
Community Development Department as evidence of a condominium project's
compliance with the requirements of this article.
CLOSING: The act of transferring ownership of a condominium unit to the
purchaser from the owner and/or developer.
CODE INSPECTION REPORT: A written report issued by the City as evidence that
all condominium units and common elements in a condominium project have been
inspected for compliance with all applicable Zoning, Building and/or other Life
Safety Code standards of the City.
COMMON ELEMENTS OR COMMON AREAS: All portions of the property except the
condominium units, including limited common elements unless otherwise
specified.
CONDOMINIUM: A form of property ownership established pursuant to the Illinois
Condominium Property Act.
CONDOMINIUM PROJECT: The sale of or plan by an owner and/or developer to sell
or offer for sale residential condominium units, commercial condominium units,
or business condominium units, or any combination thereof, in an existing
building or any modification or reconstruction of an existing building.
CONDOMINIUM PROPERTY ACT: The Illinois Condominium Property Act 2 .
CONDOMINIUM UNIT OR UNIT: A part of the property designed and intended for any
type of independent use.
CONVERSION, CONVERT OR LIKE WORDS: The offering for sale by an owner and/or
developer or their agent of a condominium unit in a "conversion condominium",
as defined in the Condominium Property Act.
DECLARANT: Any person who plans to execute or has executed the declaration or
on whose behalf the declaration is executed.
DEVELOPER: Any person or entity who/which undertakes to develop a condominium
unit or building by conversion, as further defined in the Condominium Property
Act.
DIRECTOR: The Director of Community Development or his authorized
representative.
INSURANCE: The requirements as set forth in the Condominium Property Act, 765
Illinois Compiled Statutes 605/12, and as otherwise applicable by State law.
LIMITED COMMON ELEMENTS: A portion of the common elements so designated in the
declaration as being reserved for the use of a certain condominium unit or
units to the exclusion of other condominium units, including, but not limited
to, balconies, terraces, patios and parking spaces or facilities.
OFFERING: Any inducement, solicitation, advertisement or announcement to
encourage the purchase of a condominium unit in a condominium project or
prospective condominium project.
OWNER: The titleholder of property being converted to a condominium.
PARKING SPACE: A space dedicated exclusively to the location or storage of a
motor vehicle in compliance with this Code.
PARTIAL CERTIFICATE OF CODE COMPLIANCE: A written instrument, issued by the
City, as evidence of the common elements' or an individual condominium unit's
compliance with this article.
PERSON: A natural individual, corporation, partnership, trustee, or other legal
entity capable of holding title to real property.
PROPERTY: All the land, property and space comprising the parcel, all
improvements and structures erected, constructed or contained therein or
thereon, including the building and all easements, rights and appurtenances
belonging thereto, and all fixtures and equipment intended for the mutual use,
benefit or enjoyment of the condominium unit owners, submitted to the
provisions of the Condominium Property Act.
PROSPECTIVE PURCHASER: A person who investigates the condominium project site
for the purpose of the possible purchase of one or more condominium units.
UNIT: A part of the property including one or more rooms, occupying one or more
floors or a part or parts thereof, designed and intended for any type of
independent use, and having lawful access to a public way.
UNIT OWNERS' ASSOCIATION: The association of all of the unit owners, acting
pursuant to bylaws through its duly elected board of managers. (Ord. O-18-025,
7-19-2018)
 
Notes
1 1. 765 ILCS 605/1 et seq.
2 1. 765 ILCS 605/1 et seq.
Sec. 12.1204. Construction.
